result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodrick Allen Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: count two; and consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 90 days, 1/1/2016-3/31/2016.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due  or civil judgment to be entered.  Cash bail to apply.

Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program until completed.
Seek/maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.
The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under S. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
May not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time.
No possession of any firearms or weaopns, fireawrm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster or any body armor.
May not live where a firearm is kept.
May not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.
Comply with all child support court orders.

Complete parenting or fatherhood course.
Participate in a Cognitive Behavior program or cognitive intervention program.
Driver's license suspension is not imposed.

timeConds.notes:
Without good time credit.  Release to the Day Reporting Center, if eligible; work and inmate work assignments at HOC only.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
STAYED: to be used at the discretion of the agent, except if there is a violation regarding possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammuntion, firearm magazine, firearm holster or any body armor or any new criminal charges filed against the defendant, the Defendant is to serve six (6) months of the condition time.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: count one; and consecutive to any other sentence. Release for inmate work assignments within the HOC and the Day Reporting Center only.  Credit for 90 days time served 1/1/2016-3/31/2016.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rodrick Allen Davis

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 2: 

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Case proceeded to sentencing hearing. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS 6 MONTHS, concurrent to Count 2 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 90 days time served (01/01/2016-03/31/2016); the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is  1 YEAR 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve 10 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent  to Count 1 and consecutive to any other sentence; release for inmate work assignments within the House of Correction and The Day Reporting Center ONLY; with credit for 90 days time served (01/01/2016-03/31/2016). Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
- Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program until completed. 
- Seek/Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
- Defendant to participate in a Cognitive Behavior program or cognitive intervention program.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. CASH BAIL TO APPLY. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.

- Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction with out goodtime credit; release for The Day Reporting Center (if eligible), work and inmate work assignments at the House of correction ONLY. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
Imposed and stayed, to be used at the discretion of the agent, EXCEPT, if there is a violation regarding possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor OR any new criminal charges filed against the defendant, the Defendant is to serve 6 months of the condition time. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
